conbody.p: Select the Assignments tab in the main window (see ), select an assignment from the list, and press the Publish button to initiate publication of an assignment. This will open the assignment publication dialog box.
Elements of the publication dialog box:

row.entry: List of students to receive the assignment
Remove student from the list button

conbody.p:
You can choose one of the three methods for setting the deadline by selecting an appropriate radio button:
Method Allotted time limit
Set date and time From the moment of assignment publication until specified date and time
Set number of days Specified number of days (24 hour periods) from the moment of assignment publication
Set number of hours Specified number of hours from the moment of assignment publication

You can use the Add student and Edit student buttons to add students to the list of assignment recipients or to edit their data. This will open a dialog for adding or editing student data. Student data consists of a mandatory student ID and an optional student screen name. Screen name is how the name of the student will be displayed throughout the assignment.

You can also import a class list to save the hassle of adding students manually. Press the Load class list button to import class list from a Nibelung Class List file (these files have the NCL extension). You will be prompted to select an NCL file. Student list and course title in the assignment will be filled in automatically upon a successful importation of the class list.
conbody.note: Class list file must have the student ID field filled in for every student in the class.
conbody.p: Press the Save class list button to save the student list into a Nibelung Class List file. This class list can be reused in another assignment prepared with in Remote Assignments module, as well as loaded into Dialog Nibelung itself.
conbody.note: An assignment can not be published if any of the students in the list are missing their student IDs (empty fields will be marked with red borders). Assignment also can not be published with an empty student list.
conbody.p: The class name field is optional and serves for informational purposes only.

Press the Publish button to publish the assignment. The assignment will receive the Published status, from that moment students will see the assignment upon startup or refresh of their Remote Assignments interfaces and can start working on it. This will also start the clock for the time allotted for the assignment.
Status of the assignment will change from Published to Handed out once this particular student actually receives the assignment.
Press the Cancel button to cancel without publishing the assignment. This button will close the publication dialog box without saving any modifications to the assignment.
The newly published assignment will appear in the Published assignments tab.

conbody.p: Elements of the Published assignments tab:
Press the Extend deadline button to extend the assignment deadline. A dialog box will appear on your screen.
conbody.note: Information in the Progress tab (see ) refers to the assignments selected in the Published assignments tab.
conbody.p: Press the Close button to finish working with the assignment (see ). Only assignments for which all students have turned in their work and it has been graded by the teacher can be closed. _fixme_
The Show closed assignments triggers display of closed assignments in the list. If enabled, closed assignments will be listed in gray.

conbody.p: Press the Remove button to delete current assignment. You will be asked for a confirmation.
conbody.note: Removing a published assignment will irrevocably delete the assignment, together with all attached files and associated data -- including student answers, comments, and grades -- from the cloud storage (see ). It is strongly recommended to create an assignment report (see ) and file a copy of the assignment to the archive (see ) before removing it.
